sentence.Network_en: His water-colour designs adorn a wide range of books.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的水彩设计使许多图书大为生色。
她的前额纹着靛青色的刺青。

sentence.Network_en: Several magnificent oil paintings adorn the walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 几幅恢宏的油画装点着墙面。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : via Old French from Latin adornare, from ad- 'to' + ornare 'deck, add lustre'

entry.def: If something adorns a place or an object, it makes it look more beautiful.

example.ex: His watercolour designs adorn a wide range of books...
example.tran: 他的水彩设计使许多图书大为生色。

example.ex: Several magnificent oil paintings adorn the walls.
example.tran: 几幅恢宏的油画装点着墙面。

means.word_mean: 1. make more attractive by adding ornament, colour, etc.;
3. furnish with power or authority; of kings or emperors

auth_sentence.content: Pictures of Brighton by local artists adorn the walls.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pictures of Brighton by local artists adorn the walls.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pictures of Brighton by local artists adorn the walls.

auth_sentence.content: Women have always used lipstick to adorn themselves.
auth_sentence.res_content: Women have always used lipstick to adorn themselves.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Women have always used lipstick to adorn themselves.

auth_sentence.content: Night, when Stars adorn the Skies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Night, when Stars adorn the Skies.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不加修饰的,[文体等]朴素的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+ornate充满装饰的→不装饰的
orn装饰+ate……的→adj.华美的,充满装饰的
sub在下面+orn装饰→在下面装饰[别人]→贿赂

means.word_mean: 装饰; 装扮; 佩带

sentences.en: Wild flowers adorned the river bank.
Their house is adorned with beautiful antique ornaments.
sentences.cn: 他们的房子装饰得古色古香。

jushi.english: The platform was adorned with flowers.
His small white hands were adorned with two valuable rings.
jushi.chinese: 他那白皙的小手上戴着两枚名贵的戒指。

jushi.english: A gold vase adorned the table.
jushi.chinese: 金瓶使这桌子生色不少。
